definitions.definition: used with be, do or have to form the negative of verbs; used to form the negative of modal verbs like can or must

examples.text: She did not/didn’t see him.
It’s not/It isn’t raining.
It's cold, isn't it?
Don't you eat meat?
I can't see from here.
He must not go.

definitions.definition: used to give the following word or phrase a negative meaning, or to reply in the negative

examples.text: He warned me not to be late.
I was sorry not to have seen them.
Not everybody agrees.
They had still not decided.
‘Who's next?’ ‘Not me.’
‘What did you do at school?’ ‘**Not a lot**.’
It's not easy being a parent *(= it's difficult)*.
It's not every day you get to meet a famous actor.

definitions.definition: used after hope, expect, believe, etc. to give a negative reply

examples.text: ‘Will she be there?’ ‘I hope not.’
‘Is it ready?’ ‘I'm afraid not.’
‘Does he know?’ ‘I believe not.’

definitions.definition: used to show a negative possibility

examples.text: I don't know if he's telling the truth or not.
Whether you succeed or not depends on the how skilled you are.

definitions.definition: used to say that you do not want something or will not allow something

examples.text: ‘Some more?’ ‘Not for me, thanks.’
‘Can I throw this out?’ ‘Certainly not.’
She was standing not three feet in front of me.

definitions.definition: used to suggest that the opposite of the following word or phrase is true

examples.text: This could all happen in the **not too distant future** *(= soon)*.
His view on the matter was **not a million miles away** from *(= close to)* mine.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the opposite of a statement

examples.text: Well, that sounds like a fun evening—not!

definitions.definition: used for emphasis to mean ‘no thing or person’

examples.text: He didn't speak to me—not one word.

definitions.definition: used to politely accept thanks or to agree to something

examples.text: ‘Thanks a lot.’ ‘Not at all.’
‘Do you mind if I open a window?’ ‘Not at all.’

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something else is also true

examples.text: She not only wrote the text but also selected the illustrations.
He not only read the book, but also remembered what he had read.

definitions.definition: used to state that you are not suggesting something

examples.text: She hasn't written—not that she said she would.

wordOrigin: Middle English: contraction of the adverb nought.
